CatDescriptText: Mr. Van Claxton, 40 Steuben Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "No, I don't think so. At least the ones that I know and work with on the job do not."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Van Claxton standing under Jenkins Arcade marquee, with May building in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
